AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/NPE/Tapped_.translation: 已横置的地可以在你的下一个回合中再度利用。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/OnAnAdventu.oracleText: You may cast this card as an Adventure, after you do exile it. You may then cast the {PermanentType} later from exile.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/OnAnAdventu.translation: 你可以将这张牌作为历险来施放，于其结算时，该咒语的操控者改为将其放逐，而非置入其拥有者的坟墓场。于该咒语持续被放逐期间，该牌手可以将它当作{PermanentType}咒语来施放。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Party.oracleText: Your party consists of up to one each of Cleric, Rogue, Warrior, and Wizard.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Party.translation: 冒险团由僧侣，浪客，战士和法术师组成，每种类别至多只计入一个。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Party_Addit.oracleText: Adding one of these types would increase party size:
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Party_Addit.translation: 增加一张以下类别的牌能增加冒险团规模：

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PayLifeInst.oracleText: You may play this card, if you do pay life equal to its mana value rather than pay its mana cost.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PayLifeInst.translation: 你可以使用此牌，但须支付等同其法术力值的生命，而不支付其法术力费用。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PermanentsD.oracleText: Permanents that dealt damage to you last turn:
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PermanentsD.translation: 上回合对你造成过伤害的永久物：

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Planeswalke.translation: 拥有以下所有忠诚异能

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PowerToughn.oracleText: Effects that modify toughness apply to power and effects that modify power apply to toughness
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/PowerToughn.translation: 会改变其防御力的效应将会对其力量生效，而会改变其力量的效应将会对其防御力生效

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Replacement.oracleText: Exile this spell as it resolves. You may cast the creature later from exile.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Replacement.translation: 在此咒语结算时将其放逐。 你之后可以从放逐区中施放该生物。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Replacement.oracleText: If this permanent would die this turn, exile it instead.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Replacement.translation: 如果本回合中此生物将死去，则改为将它放逐。
防止此物件造成的伤害
防止对此物件造成的伤害

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Restricted_.oracleText:
This card is restricted in the following formats:
{formats}
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Restricted_.translation:
此牌在下列赛制中被限用：
{formats}

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/RevealedToO.oracleText: You have revealed this card to your opponent.

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Satoru_Umez.oracleText: <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x2"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xU"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xB">, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Satoru_Umez.translation: <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x2"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xU"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xB">，将一个由你操控且未受阻挡的攻击生物移回其拥有者手上：将此牌从你手上横置放进战场，且正进行攻击。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SnowManaSou.oracleText: <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xS"> can be paid with one mana from a snow source.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SnowManaSou.translation: <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xS"> 可以用产自雪境来源的法术力支付。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.oracleText: An opponent controls more creatures than you.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.translation: 有对手操控比你更多的生物。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.oracleText: An opponent has more cards in hand than you.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.translation: 有对手拥有比你更多的手牌。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.oracleText: An opponent has more life than you.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/SunsetRevel.translation: 有对手拥有比你更多的生命。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/TempBanned_.oracleText: This card is temporarily prohibited and not legal in any format.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/TempBanned_.translation: 这张牌被临时禁用，在任何赛制都不合法。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/TokenAffini.oracleText: This spell costs <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x1"> less to cast for each token you control.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/TokenAffini.translation: 你每操控一个衍生物，此咒语便减少<sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x1"> 来施放。

AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Wildcard/Wi.oracleText: Redeem this wildcard for any {rarity} card by adding the desired card to your deck.
AbilityHanger/SpecialHangers/Wildcard/Wi.translation: 此万用牌可用于兑换任意{rarity}牌。只需往套牌中加入对应稀有度的牌张即可完成兑换。

AbilityHanger/TotalManaValueOwnedInExile.oracleText: Total mana value of cards you own in exile.
AbilityHanger/TotalManaValueOwnedInExile.translation: 由你拥有的所有被放逐牌的法术力值总和

AbilityHanger_Keyword_Meld_Body.oracleText: Melding a pair of cards results in a single combined permanent. Copies can't be melded.
AbilityHanger_Keyword_Meld_Body.translation: 将一组牌融合在一起会得到一个组合永久物。复制品不能进行融合。

BanAnnouncement/Ban_Announcement_Body_Ba.oracleText:
The following changes to the MTG Arena banned list have taken effect:

Format
* {cardName} is banned
* {cardName} is unbanned

BanAnnouncement/Ban_Announcement_Website.oracleText: You can read the full announcement here.
BanAnnouncement/Ban_Announcement_Website.translation: 你可以在这里阅读完整的公告。

BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.oracleText:
Effective on {Date}, the following changes to the MTG Arena banned list will take effect:

Format
* {cardName} is banned
* {cardName} is unbanned
Cards banned in Standard will not appear in store or prize boosters, but will still appear in Draft and Sealed events.
BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.translation: 在标准赛中被禁用的牌无法从商品或奖品补充包中获得，但仍会在轮抽或现开赛事中出现。

BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.oracleText: Players acquiring a banned card in a Draft or Sealed event will gain vault progress as though they have four copies of the card.
BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.translation: 牌手在轮抽或现开赛事中获得的禁用牌会自动计入宝库进度当中，就如同你已拥有四张该牌的同名牌一般。

BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.oracleText: Players will receive a Wildcard of the corresponding rarity for each copy of a banned card in their collection.
BanAnnouncement/Upcoming_Ban_Announcemen.translation: 牌手收藏中每有一张禁用牌，便会获得一张同等稀有度的万用牌。

Card/SiegeAbilityOverrideText.oracleText: When the last defense counter is removed from this permanent, exile it, then you may cast it transformed without paying its mana cost.
Card/SiegeAbilityOverrideText.translation: 当移去此永久物上最后一个布防指示物时，将之放逐，然后你可以施放已转化的它且不需支付其法术力费用。

Card/Styles/MOD/CharacterLevels.translation: 本模组适合人物等级{characterLevels}的玩家冒险

Card/Textbox/NumberOfInstantAndSorceryCa.oracleText: Instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard: {quantity}
Card/Textbox/NumberOfInstantAndSorceryCa.translation: 你坟墓场中的法术和瞬间牌总数为：{quantity}

Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_1.oracleText: As your Ring-bearer this is legendary and can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.
Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_1.translation: 作为你的持戒人，它是传奇且不能被力量比它大的生物阻挡。

Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_2.oracleText: Whenever this attacks, draw a card, then discard a card.
Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_2.translation: 每当你的持戒人攻击时，抓一张牌，然后弃一张牌。

Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_3.oracleText: Whenever this becomes blocked by a creature, that creature's controller sacrifices it at end of combat.
Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_3.translation: 每当你的持戒人被一个生物阻挡，在战斗结束时该生物的操控者将它牺牲。

Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_4.oracleText: Whenever this deals combat damage to a player, each opponent loses 3 life.
Card/Textbox/RingBearer_Body_4.translation: 每当你的持戒人对任一牌手造成战斗伤害时，每位对手各失去 3 点生命。

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_BG_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Fill up your graveyard with goodies to use, reuse, and abuse its contents against your terrified opponents!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_BG_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Fill up your graveyard with goodies to use, reuse, and abuse its contents against your terrified opponents!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_BR_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Control the battlefield and your opponents with potent artifacts, then smelt them into something entirely new!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_BR_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Control the battlefield and your opponents with potent artifacts, then smelt them into something entirely new!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_GU_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Create vast amounts of mana to set loose giant creatures far quicker than your opponents could ever expect!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_GU_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Create vast amounts of mana to set loose giant creatures far quicker than your opponents could ever expect!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_GW_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Flood the battlefield with creatures of all shapes and sizes and get ready to party!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_GW_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Flood the battlefield with creatures of all shapes and sizes and get ready to party!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_RG_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Unleash your ferocious werewolves at night to stalk your unsuspecting prey. Awooo!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_RG_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Unleash your ferocious werewolves at night to stalk your unsuspecting prey. Awooo!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_RW_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Study the blade and harness the power of your samurai to unleash an avalanche of swords against all who would defy you!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_RW_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Study the blade and harness the power of your samurai to unleash an avalanche of swords against all who would defy you!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_UB_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Use your sneaky ninjas to strike your opponents when and where they least expect. Believe it!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_UB_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Use your sneaky ninjas to strike your opponents when and where they least expect. Believe it!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_UR_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Combine instants and sorceries together to create something truly wonderous and claim victory!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_UR_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Combine instants and sorceries together to create something truly wonderous and claim victory!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_WB_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Maintain the balance between artifact and enchantment spells, and all your opponents will fall!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_WB_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Maintain the balance between artifact and enchantment spells, and all your opponents will fall!

Codex/2023/StarterDeck_WU_Description.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Smite foes with your glorious angels as they fly over your opponent's creatures to count up the wins!
Codex/2023/StarterDeck_WU_Description.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Smite foes with your glorious angels as they fly over your opponent's creatures to count up the wins!

Codex/Decks_BasicLands.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>If you have a specific basic land in your collection, you'll be able to use as many copies of it as you'd like. Many basic lands from each set are already in your collection, but you can also find more in the Store from time to time!
Codex/Decks_BasicLands.translation: <color #CCCCCC>如果你的收藏里有某个基本地，那么你可以使用任意数量的该基本地。每个系列的普通基本地都已经在你的收藏中，你还可以在商店中找到更多好看的！

Codex/Decks_Collection.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Additionally, this is where you can view all the cards in your <color #E9E9F6><b>Collection.
Codex/Decks_Collection.translation: <color #CCCCCC>另外，在这里你还可以查看你拥有的所有卡<color #E9E9F6><b>收藏。

Codex/Decks_EarnCards.oracleText: <color #ED5922>You can earn cards in a variety of ways:
Codex/Decks_EarnCards.translation: <color #ED5922>你可以通过多种方式获得卡牌：

Codex/Decks_EarnCards_List.oracleText:
• Open in a booster pack from your collection (purchasable in the Store)
• Choose in a draft or Open in a sealed event that is not phantom (Cards in phantom events are not added to your collection, and most events are not phantom)
• Earn as a reward
• Craft using a wildcard of the same rarity
• Level Up your Set Mastery or Mastery Pass
• Purchase in the Store usually in a bundle.
Codex/Decks_EarnCards_List.translation:
• Open in a booster pack from your collection (purchasable in the Store)
• Choose in a draft or Open in a sealed event that is not phantom (Cards in phantom events are not added to your collection, and most events are not phantom)
• Earn as a reward
• Craft using a wildcard of the same rarity
• Level Up your Set Mastery or Mastery Pass
• Purchase in the Store usually in a bundle.

Codex/Decks_FourCopies.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>If you receive a card you already have four exact copies of, then you'll earn gems instead, since you cannot play more than 4 copies of any card in a constructed event.
Codex/Decks_FourCopies.translation: <color #CCCCCC>If you receive a card you already have four exact copies of, then you'll earn gems instead, since you cannot play more than 4 copies of any card in a constructed event.

Codex/Decks_Import.oracleText: You can also Import decks from outside of MTG Arena, and if you already have the cards, then you can jump right in! If you don't, then you'll be shown exactly how many wild cards are required to finish that particular deck before playing with it. Wild cards can be gained from various sources, and allow you to craft any card of the same rarity to use in as many different decks as you'd like!
Codex/Decks_Import.translation: You can also Import decks from outside of MTG Arena, and if you already have the cards, then you can jump right in! If you don't, then you'll be shown exactly how many wild cards are required to finish that particular deck before playing with it. Wild cards can be gained from various sources, and allow you to craft any card of the same rarity to use in as many different decks as you'd like!

Codex/Decks_Intro.oracleText: The Decks scene is where you can Create and Edit decks before playing with them in constructed events and queues. Many players find that brewing new decks and modifying existing ones is one of the best parts of the game!
Codex/Decks_Intro.translation: The Decks scene is where you can Create and Edit decks before playing with them in constructed events and queues. Many players find that brewing new decks and modifying existing ones is one of the best parts of the game!

Codex/Decks_Reassurance.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>There are many cards in the game so while it's easy to get overwhelmed, if you stick with it, you'll be an amazing deck builder in no time!
Codex/Decks_Reassurance.translation: <color #CCCCCC>There are many cards in the game so while it's easy to get overwhelmed, if you stick with it, you'll be an amazing deck builder in no time!

Codex/Decks_StarterDecks.oracleText: A good place to start is with opening one of the Starter Decks and adapting it to your playstyle. Or by adding in that new exciting card you just got (and probably removing an existing card to do so).
Codex/Decks_StarterDecks.translation: A good place to start is with opening one of the Starter Decks and adapting it to your playstyle. Or by adding in that new exciting card you just got (and probably removing an existing card to do so).

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_A.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Once you have cast a spell it resolves. If it's a creature, its two main functions are attacking and blocking!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_A.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Once you have cast a spell it resolves. If it's a creature, its two main functions are attacking and blocking!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>To attack, you'll be prompted to declare your attackers, and can select the creatures to attack with. They will automatically tap, and head into the red zone. Creatures can't attack the turn you cast them because they have something informally called "summoning sickness" by default.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>To attack, you'll be prompted to declare your attackers, and can select the creatures to attack with. They will automatically tap, and head into the red zone. Creatures can't attack the turn you cast them because they have something informally called "summoning sickness" by default.

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_C.oracleText: Once you've attacked the other player can choose to block! Creatures can only block one creature, but you can have more than one of your creatures all gang up on one of your opponent's creatures. Creature can block on your opponent's turn, even if you just cast them in your previous turn!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_C.translation: Once you've attacked the other player can choose to block! Creatures can only block one creature, but you can have more than one of your creatures all gang up on one of your opponent's creatures. Creature can block on your opponent's turn, even if you just cast them in your previous turn!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_D.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Creatures attacking and blocking is one of the core elements to playing Magic, and this "combat math" can get complex, but there's a battlefield tactician in you just waiting to come out!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Attacking_D.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Creatures attacking and blocking is one of the core elements to playing Magic, and this "combat math" can get complex, but there's a battlefield tactician in you just waiting to come out!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_A.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>In most ways to play Magic, each player begins with a starting life total of 20 and draws seven cards to start. Players can then "mulligan" to draw a new set of cards until they find one they like. Each time you mulligan, you have to put a card from that opening hand on the bottom of your library, so decide carefully!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_A.translation: <color #CCCCCC>In most ways to play Magic, each player begins with a starting life total of 20 and draws seven cards to start. Players can then "mulligan" to draw a new set of cards until they find one they like. Each time you mulligan, you have to put a card from that opening hand on the bottom of your library, so decide carefully!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>And then throughout that game, each player will summon creatures that can attack players, and cast powerful spells that can affect the battlefield, or even call upon Planeswalker allies to help them claim victory!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>And then throughout that game, each player will summon creatures that can attack players, and cast powerful spells that can affect the battlefield, or even call upon Planeswalker allies to help them claim victory!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_C.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>A player can lose the game in a few ways. Usually, it's when that player's life total is reduced to 0. Another way is when a player can't draw a card because their library (face down deck) has zero cards in it. Or here on MTG Arena, if a player hasn't taken an action in a while, they will automatically concede. There are plenty more ways to win (or lose) a game of Magic, so keep an eye out!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_C.translation: <color #CCCCCC>A player can lose the game in a few ways. Usually, it's when that player's life total is reduced to 0. Another way is when a player can't draw a card because their library (face down deck) has zero cards in it. Or here on MTG Arena, if a player hasn't taken an action in a while, they will automatically concede. There are plenty more ways to win (or lose) a game of Magic, so keep an eye out!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_D.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>In between the beginning and ending of a game, is where all the good stuff happens! So whether you're playing a game of Brawl with a friend or a game of Sealed in an Arena Open for monetary rewards, there's plenty of games to begin and end!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_D.translation: <color #CCCCCC>In between the beginning and ending of a game, is where all the good stuff happens! So whether you're playing a game of Brawl with a friend or a game of Sealed in an Arena Open for monetary rewards, there's plenty of games to begin and end!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_I.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>One of the best ways to learn Magic is to jump in a game! But if you want to know a little more before playing, you've come to the right place!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/BeginAndEnd_I.translation: <color #CCCCCC>学习万智牌的最好方法之一就是加入一局游戏。但如果你想在游戏开始前了解更多有关信息，那你就来对地方了！

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_A.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>While you can play one land a turn no problem, you'll need to tap those lands to pay for spells! Every card that isn't a land is a spell.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_A.translation: <color #CCCCCC>你每回合可以使用一个地，你需要横置这些地来施放咒语！每张不是地的牌都是咒语。

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>To attack, you will be prompted to declare your attackers, and can select the creatures to attack with. They will automatically tap, and head into the red zone. Creatures can't attack the turn you cast them because they have something informally called "summoning sickness" by default.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>To attack, you will be prompted to declare your attackers, and can select the creatures to attack with. They will automatically tap, and head into the red zone. Creatures can't attack the turn you cast them because they have something informally called "summoning sickness" by default.

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_C.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>You will need to pay 1 mana for each symbol in a card's mana cost that matches that color. For example, swamps add <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xB"> You'll also need to pay generic mana equal to the number there too.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_C.translation: <color #CCCCCC>You will need to pay 1 mana for each symbol in a card's mana cost that matches that color. For example, swamps add <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xB"> You'll also need to pay generic mana equal to the number there too.

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_D.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>So if a card costs <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x2"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xU"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xR">, you will need to add 4 total mana, with at least one blue mana, and one red mana. On Arena, if you can cast a spell, not only will it be highlighted, but the lands Arena chooses to automatically tap to cast it will be highlighted as well.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_D.translation: <color #CCCCCC>So if a card costs <sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="x2"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xU"><sprite="SpriteSheet_ManaIcons" name="xR">, you will need to add 4 total mana, with at least one blue mana, and one red mana. On Arena, if you can cast a spell, not only will it be highlighted, but the lands Arena chooses to automatically tap to cast it will be highlighted as well.

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_E.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Some cards even let you cast spells without paying their mana cost, or just put them onto the battlefield. Such value!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Casting_E.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Some cards even let you cast spells without paying their mana cost, or just put them onto the battlefield. Such value!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/GameActions_I.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>There are many actions you take during a game of Magic, and here are some of the most important ones!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/GameActions_I.translation: <color #CCCCCC>There are many actions you take during a game of Magic, and here are some of the most important ones!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/GoldenRule_Te.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>While you're playing Magic, remember: Whenever a card's text directly contradicts a rule, the card takes precedence in that specific situation. The only exception is that a player can concede the game at any time. You can always jump right back into another game!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/GoldenRule_Te.translation: <color #CCCCCC>在你玩万智牌的时候，请记住：每当某张牌的规则叙述直接抵触这些规则时，以牌上的叙述为优先。这张牌只能在此特殊状况下取代其所抵触的规则。唯一的例外是：牌手随时都可以认输一盘游戏。

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_A.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Cards are turned sideways to show they have been used for the turn. You'll untap all permanents (cards on the battlefield) you control at the beginning of your turn.
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_A.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Cards are turned sideways to show they have been used for the turn. You'll untap all permanents (cards on the battlefield) you control at the beginning of your turn.

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>You tap your lands to cast spells and tap your creatures to attack. Some creatures and artifacts can also tap to activate abilities. Some cards even untap others so you're not limited to activating that ability only once a turn!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>You tap your lands to cast spells and tap your creatures to attack. Some creatures and artifacts can also tap to activate abilities. Some cards even untap others so you're not limited to activating that ability only once a turn!

Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_C.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Some players play decks that don't even cast spells on their own turn! While most cards are only played during your turn, instants and cards with flash can be played almost anytime. If your opponent has two islands untapped, keep your guard up!
Codex/HowToPlay/QuickStart/Tapping_C.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Some players play decks that don't even cast spells on their own turn! While most cards are only played during your turn, instants and cards with flash can be played almost anytime. If your opponent has two islands untapped, keep your guard up!

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_BG_desc.oracleText: Unleash the power of life and death, consigning all creatures to the graveyard. But yours won't stay there for long!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_BG_desc.translation: 释放死生之力，将所有生物送进坟场。但你的生物不久便能复活！

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_BW_desc.oracleText: Command the relentless power of Phyrexia and swarm over your enemies with your unstoppable army of biomechanical zealots!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_BW_desc.translation: 统御非瑞克西亚残酷之力，用势不可挡的生物机械狂热者大军吞没你的敌人！

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RB_desc.oracleText: Conjure implements of malice and be willing to sacrifice your own creatures and artifice in pursuit of power.
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RB_desc.translation: 变出恶意的工具，并愿意牺牲自己的生物和神器来追求力量。

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RG_desc.oracleText: Unleash the might of dragons and dinosaurs to blast through your opponent's defenses.
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RG_desc.translation: 释放巨龙和恐龙的强大力量来冲破对手的防御。

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RW_desc.oracleText: Suit up your rebellious forces with potent equipment and fight valiantly in the name of Mirrodin!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_RW_desc.translation: 为你的反抗军装备强大的武具，以秘罗地之名英勇作战！

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UB_desc.oracleText: Uncover the secrets of the past and remove all who would stand in your way with esoteric spells.
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UB_desc.translation: 使用深奥咒语揭开往日的秘密，扫清挡路的敌人。

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UG_desc.oracleText: Join forces with elves and foresee your glorious victory with memory and might.
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UG_desc.translation: 与精灵联手，用记忆和力量预见你的辉煌胜利。

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UR_desc.oracleText: Master arcane wizardry to weave together knowledge and fire in a dizzying flurry of spellcraft!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UR_desc.translation: 掌握奥术魔法，将知识和火焰编织成令人眼花缭乱的法术！

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UW_desc.oracleText: Soar above your opponents with your skyborne soldiers and ride the winds of victory!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_UW_desc.translation: 与你的天空战士一起乘着胜利之风翱翔在你的对手之上！

Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_WG_desc.oracleText: Cultivate your spirits, elementals, and elephants into an indomitable power that will triumph over all others!
Codex/Precon/Precon_EPP2024_WG_desc.translation: 培养你的精怪、元素和大象，使其成为一种不屈不挠的力量，战胜一切！

Codex/Profile_Constructed.oracleText: Constructed formats are where you bring your own deck such as Standard, Alchemy, Explorer, and Historic. You can only use cards legal in that format, but the "rules" for the game are the same in all of these constructed formats. Your results in these formats only affect your rank if you play in the ranked queue. Most events and the play queue let you battle with no pressure!
Codex/Profile_Constructed.translation: Constructed formats are where you bring your own deck such as Standard, Alchemy, Explorer, and Historic. You can only use cards legal in that format, but the "rules" for the game are the same in all of these constructed formats. Your results in these formats only affect your rank if you play in the ranked queue. Most events and the play queue let you battle with no pressure!

Codex/Profile_Intro.oracleText: The Profile scene shows you all the information about, well, you! You can also customize your default Emotes, Companions, Sleeves, and Avatar! Any changes you make to specific decks will take priority over your defaults set here.
Codex/Profile_Intro.translation: The Profile scene shows you all the information about, well, you! You can also customize your default Emotes, Companions, Sleeves, and Avatar! Any changes you make to specific decks will take priority over your defaults set here.

Codex/Profile_Limited.oracleText: Limited formats are where you build your deck during the event, such as Draft or Sealed. Premier Draft, Quick Draft, and Sealed affect your limited rating, while Traditional Draft does not.
Codex/Profile_Limited.translation: Limited formats are where you build your deck during the event, such as Draft or Sealed. Premier Draft, Quick Draft, and Sealed affect your limited rating, while Traditional Draft does not.

Codex/Profile_Ranking.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>If your ranking is displayed before the name of a queue or event, then your results there will affect your ranking. Is it time to prove that your new brew has what it takes, or that it's correct to play that 41st card?
Codex/Profile_Ranking.translation: <color #CCCCCC>If your ranking is displayed before the name of a queue or event, then your results there will affect your ranking. Is it time to prove that your new brew has what it takes, or that it's correct to play that 41st card?

Codex/Profile_Season.oracleText: You can compete to improve your ranking in each Season and they reset at the end of each month. And the best part is you can earn rewards based on how you finish! Rewards will be given for both ranks, and you can select your rank to find out exactly how much you are able to earn.
Codex/Profile_Season.translation: You can compete to improve your ranking in each Season and they reset at the end of each month. And the best part is you can earn rewards based on how you finish! Rewards will be given for both ranks, and you can select your rank to find out exactly how much you are able to earn.

Codex/Profile_SeasonalRank.oracleText: Here is also where you see your Seasonal Rank. You have two ranks: Constructed and Limited. All ranked Constructed events will impact your singular Constructed rank, and likewise, the same is true for Limited. If you're just starting off on your journey, you might just have one rank here: Spark Rank! There is much for you to explore and learn as you rank up...
Codex/Profile_SeasonalRank.translation: Here is also where you see your Seasonal Rank. You have two ranks: Constructed and Limited. All ranked Constructed events will impact your singular Constructed rank, and likewise, the same is true for Limited. If you're just starting off on your journey, you might just have one rank here: Spark Rank! There is much for you to explore and learn as you rank up...

Codex/RotationRenewal_1.oracleText: Renewal is an event that happens every fall here on MTG Arena. It is a time of change and new beginnings as we rotate cards out of Standard and Alchemy, and roll in celebratory gifts for all players in the form of the yearly Renewal Egg!
Codex/RotationRenewal_1.translation: Renewal is an event that happens every fall here on MTG Arena. It is a time of change and new beginnings as we rotate cards out of Standard and Alchemy, and roll in celebratory gifts for all players in the form of the yearly Renewal Egg!

Codex/RotationRenewal_2.oracleText: During Renewal Season, both MTG Arena and tabletop Magic: The Gathering will rotate. Upon the release of the autumn set, around four or so of the "oldest" sets in Standard and Alchemy will "rotate" out, which means they will no longer be legal in those formats. However they will remain legal in MTG Arena's non-rotating game modes like Historic, Explorer, and Historic Brawl.
Codex/RotationRenewal_2.translation: During Renewal Season, both MTG Arena and tabletop Magic: The Gathering will rotate. Upon the release of the autumn set, around four or so of the "oldest" sets in Standard and Alchemy will "rotate" out, which means they will no longer be legal in those formats. However they will remain legal in MTG Arena's non-rotating game modes like Historic, Explorer, and Historic Brawl.

Codex/RotationRenewal_3.oracleText: More importantly, you will see the Renewal Egg on your Profile! This is both a reminder that rotation is coming up and it holds a package containing some special rewards that will help kick off the new year! Hovering over the Egg will show how much time is left until rotation when the Egg will open.
Codex/RotationRenewal_3.translation: More importantly, you will see the Renewal Egg on your Profile! This is both a reminder that rotation is coming up and it holds a package containing some special rewards that will help kick off the new year! Hovering over the Egg will show how much time is left until rotation when the Egg will open.

Codex/RotationRenewal_4.oracleText: Note: In 2023, Standard will not rotate. Cards will rotate out of Alchemy like normal, which will maintain Alchemy's two years worth of cards, while expanding Standard to three years!
Codex/RotationRenewal_4.translation: Note: In 2023, Standard will not rotate. Cards will rotate out of Alchemy like normal, which will maintain Alchemy's two years worth of cards, while expanding Standard to three years!

Codex/RotationRenewal_5.oracleText: This means that when Rotation occurs in 2023 with the release of Wilds of Eldraine in September, these five sets will no longer be legal in Alchemy, but will remain legal in Standard until Rotation occurs again in 2024!
Codex/RotationRenewal_5.translation: This means that when Rotation occurs in 2023 with the release of Wilds of Eldraine in September, these five sets will no longer be legal in Alchemy, but will remain legal in Standard until Rotation occurs again in 2024!

Codex/RotationRenewal_6.oracleText:
• Innistrad: Crimson Vow
• Innistrad: Midnight Hunt
• Kamigawa: Neon Dynasty
• Streets of New Capenna
• Alchemy Horizons: Baldur's Gate
Codex/RotationRenewal_6.translation:
• Innistrad: Crimson Vow
• Innistrad: Midnight Hunt
• Kamigawa: Neon Dynasty
• Streets of New Capenna
• Alchemy Horizons: Baldur's Gate

Codex/RotationRenewal_7.oracleText: Renewal also is our time to update various play modes such as Jump In!, Quick Draft, and the 10 two-color Starter Decks with cards from the newest sets. So be sure to come celebrate with us here on MTG Arena as we rotate out the old, ring in the new, and explore even more corners of the Multiverse!
Codex/RotationRenewal_7.translation: Renewal also is our time to update various play modes such as Jump In!, Quick Draft, and the 10 two-color Starter Decks with cards from the newest sets. So be sure to come celebrate with us here on MTG Arena as we rotate out the old, ring in the new, and explore even more corners of the Multiverse!

Codex/ThePlayBlade_Events.oracleText: Events will show you every event that is currently available for you to join. There are filters on the right for you to narrow down all the choices, with newer events, The Color Challenge, and events you've already joined near the top!
Codex/ThePlayBlade_Events.translation: Events will show you every event that is currently available for you to join. There are filters on the right for you to narrow down all the choices, with newer events, The Color Challenge, and events you've already joined near the top!

Codex/ThePlayBlade_FindMatch.oracleText:
Find Match lets you join constructed queues: Ranked, Play, and Brawl!

• Ranked puts your skills to the test in four constructed formats: Standard, Alchemy, Historic, and Explorer. Matches in this queue will affect your seasonal ranking. You can toggle to choose to play in Best of One, where you play a single game, or Best of Three, where games include sideboarding, and the first player to win two games wins the match.

• Play lets you play the same four formats, but these do not impact your constructed rank. You can still choose Best of One or Best of Three, and you can even play against Sparky in a Bot Match!
• Brawl is where you play the casual singleton formats of Standard Brawl and Historic Brawl! So choose a Commander, add single copies of 59 or 60 other cards, and battle!
Codex/ThePlayBlade_FindMatch.translation:
Find Match lets you join constructed queues: Ranked, Play, and Brawl!

• Ranked puts your skills to the test in four constructed formats: Standard, Alchemy, Historic, and Explorer. Matches in this queue will affect your seasonal ranking. You can toggle to choose to play in Best of One, where you play a single game, or Best of Three, where games include sideboarding, and the first player to win two games wins the match.

• Play lets you play the same four formats, but these do not impact your constructed rank. You can still choose Best of One or Best of Three, and you can even play against Sparky in a Bot Match!
• Brawl is where you play the casual singleton formats of Standard Brawl and Historic Brawl! So choose a Commander, add single copies of 59 or 60 other cards, and battle!

Codex/ThePlayBlade_PlayButton.oracleText:
The Play Blade can be opened with the large orange button that says "Play" on the bottom right of the first screen you see, the Home Scene. It's the best way to get into a game of Magic!

You'll be met with 3 different ways to find just the game you're looking for:

• Events
• Find Match
• Recently Played
Codex/ThePlayBlade_PlayButton.translation:
The Play Blade can be opened with the large orange button that says "Play" on the bottom right of the first screen you see, the Home Scene. It's the best way to get into a game of Magic!

You'll be met with 3 different ways to find just the game you're looking for:

• Events
• Find Match
• Recently Played

Codex/ThePlayBlade_RecentlyPlayed.oracleText:
Recently Played will simply display the most recent events and queues you played. So get back in there and show 'em the updates you just made to your new favorite deck!

While the Play Blade isn't the only way to jump into a game, it's certainly one of the easiest and quickest ways. So what are you waiting for?
Codex/ThePlayBlade_RecentlyPlayed.translation:
Recently Played will simply display the most recent events and queues you played. So get back in there and show 'em the updates you just made to your new favorite deck!

While the Play Blade isn't the only way to jump into a game, it's certainly one of the easiest and quickest ways. So what are you waiting for?

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Add.oracleText: <color #ED5922>While those are the 4 main constructed formats, on Arena, that's not all:
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Add.translation: <color #ED5922>While those are the 4 main constructed formats, on Arena, that's not all:

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Alc.oracleText:
Alchemy is a rotating format similar to Standard except for one main difference: players can also play with digital cards not present in paper! This could be cards from Standard that have been "rebalanced" to allow for new strategies, or even entirely new cards released in each set's Alchemy drop. These cards do things on MTG Arena that aren't possible in paper and might have you approaching this format differently. That combined with our ability to balance cards that aren't seeing a lot of play (or too much play), make Alchemy an ever-changing format!

A change new to 2023 is that while Standard rotates every three years, Alchemy still rotates only every two years. When Wilds of Eldraine releases in September of 2023, Alchemy will rotate, thus making it a "smaller" format than Standard! A great place to start would be playing with any of the 10 Starter Decks and adding in any digital-first cards you may come across!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Alc.translation:
Alchemy is a rotating format similar to Standard except for one main difference: players can also play with digital cards not present in paper! This could be cards from Standard that have been "rebalanced" to allow for new strategies, or even entirely new cards released in each set's Alchemy drop. These cards do things on MTG Arena that aren't possible in paper and might have you approaching this format differently. That combined with our ability to balance cards that aren't seeing a lot of play (or too much play), make Alchemy an ever-changing format!

A change new to 2023 is that while Standard rotates every three years, Alchemy still rotates only every two years. When Wilds of Eldraine releases in September of 2023, Alchemy will rotate, thus making it a "smaller" format than Standard! A great place to start would be playing with any of the 10 Starter Decks and adding in any digital-first cards you may come across!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_B.oracleText: These formats, like limited, can be played as Best of One where players play only a single game, or a Traditional Best of Three variant where the winner of the match is the player who wins two games.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_B.translation: These formats, like limited, can be played as Best of One where players play only a single game, or a Traditional Best of Three variant where the winner of the match is the player who wins two games.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Bot.oracleText: And finally, we have the Arena for you to battle our wonderful mascot: Sparky! While this is technically not a format, since you can bring any deck legal in any format, it's still a place where you can test out a new deck without playing against other humans. Just don't let her catch you going easy on her!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Bot.translation: And finally, we have the Arena for you to battle our wonderful mascot: Sparky! While this is technically not a format, since you can bring any deck legal in any format, it's still a place where you can test out a new deck without playing against other humans. Just don't let her catch you going easy on her!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Bra.oracleText: Standard Brawl, and its cousin, Brawl, are constructed formats, but not ones that MTG Arena features in a competitive or premier play capacity. In fact, they are neither in the Ranked or Play queue, but in their own category!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Bra.translation: Standard Brawl, and its cousin, Brawl, are constructed formats, but not ones that MTG Arena features in a competitive or premier play capacity. In fact, they are neither in the Ranked or Play queue, but in their own category!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_C.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Each deck also can employ an optional "sideboard", or cards that are "outside the game". Usually, they are used in games after the first when playing Best of Three, but sometimes even in Best of One, you might find some cards that let you use these sideboard cards. The maximum number of cards you may include in a sideboard is 7 in Best of One, and 15 in Best of Three.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_C.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Each deck also can employ an optional "sideboard", or cards that are "outside the game". Usually, they are used in games after the first when playing Best of Three, but sometimes even in Best of One, you might find some cards that let you use these sideboard cards. The maximum number of cards you may include in a sideboard is 7 in Best of One, and 15 in Best of Three.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Com.oracleText: Their closest analogue is the tabletop format, Commander, but with a few key differences. While you still select a Legendary card to be the commander of your singleton constructed deck, in Brawl you can choose any Planeswalker as well! Standard Brawl only uses cards legal in Standard. Meanwhile, Brawl has a minimum deck size of 100, and can use cards legal in Historic: which is almost every card on MTG Arena!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Com.translation: Their closest analogue is the tabletop format, Commander, but with a few key differences. While you still select a Legendary card to be the commander of your singleton constructed deck, in Brawl you can choose any Planeswalker as well! Standard Brawl only uses cards legal in Standard. Meanwhile, Brawl has a minimum deck size of 100, and can use cards legal in Historic: which is almost every card on MTG Arena!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Exp.oracleText: Explorer, like Standard, is a true-to-paper format. However, unlike Standard, it's non-rotating, which means cards are legal in it eternally! It generally includes every card legal in Standard if that set was available on MTG Arena. If a card is present on Arena, and was legal in Standard since around 2013, it is also legal. Again, MTG Arena makes understanding card legality easy, and deckbuilding filters can help you find just the card you need!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Exp.translation: Explorer, like Standard, is a true-to-paper format. However, unlike Standard, it's non-rotating, which means cards are legal in it eternally! It generally includes every card legal in Standard if that set was available on MTG Arena. If a card is present on Arena, and was legal in Standard since around 2013, it is also legal. Again, MTG Arena makes understanding card legality easy, and deckbuilding filters can help you find just the card you need!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_For.oracleText: <color #ED5922>There five main MTG Arena formats to consider when creating (or importing) a new deck:
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_For.translation: <color #ED5922>当创建（或导入）一副新套牌时，需要考虑万智牌竞技场上五种主要赛制。

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_His.oracleText: Historic is similar to Explorer in that cards never rotate out. The biggest difference is that the vast majority of cards on MTG Arena are at your disposal, including digital-first cards and paper cards predating 2013. In fact, if a card hasn't been banned or suspended, then it's most likely legal here! If you're looking for a broad but curated Magic: The Gathering experience, then Historic might be the format for you!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_His.translation: 与探险类似，史迹卡牌永远不会退环境。最大的区别在于你可以任意使用万智牌竞技场中绝大多数卡牌，包括数字版本优先卡牌和早于2013年的实体卡牌。事实上，如果一张牌没有被禁用或停权，那么极有可能在这里合法。如果你正想要体验牌池更广但卡牌有修正的万智牌，那么史记也许对你胃口！

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.oracleText: Constructed events are where you build a deck from cards in your collection before you join the event and bring it to battle other players! Decks have a minimum of 60 cards, and usually play 22-25 lands. There are many constructed formats for Magic: The Gathering, but in MTG Arena, they are defined by their status of "rotating" or not, and if they use digital only cards not available in tabletop Magic: The Gathering.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.translation: Constructed events are where you build a deck from cards in your collection before you join the event and bring it to battle other players! Decks have a minimum of 60 cards, and usually play 22-25 lands. There are many constructed formats for Magic: The Gathering, but in MTG Arena, they are defined by their status of "rotating" or not, and if they use digital only cards not available in tabletop Magic: The Gathering.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.oracleText: These formats, like limited, can be played as Best of One where players play only a single game, or a Traditional Best of Three variant where the winner of the match is the player who wins two games.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.translation: These formats, like limited, can be played as Best of One where players play only a single game, or a Traditional Best of Three variant where the winner of the match is the player who wins two games.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Each deck also can employ an optional "sideboard", or cards that are "outside the game". Usually, they are used in games after the first when playing Best of Three, but sometimes even in Best of One, you might find some cards that let you use these sideboard cards. The maximum number of cards you may include in a sideboard is 7 in Best of One, and 15 in Best of Three.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Int.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Each deck also can employ an optional "sideboard", or cards that are "outside the game". Usually, they are used in games after the first when playing Best of Three, but sometimes even in Best of One, you might find some cards that let you use these sideboard cards. The maximum number of cards you may include in a sideboard is 7 in Best of One, and 15 in Best of Three.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Sta.oracleText:
Standard is Magic: The Gathering's flagship format and is the most widely sanctioned format at all levels of organized play. It's comprised of cards from most sets released in the last three years and is the same format whether you play it on MTG Arena, or on tabletop with paper cards. Rotation is an event usually every year where older cards "rotate" out and are no longer legal, while newer cards can still be played! That way the format is always "fresh" and new strategies and discoveries are always happening. On MTG Arena, we call it "Renewal" and celebrate this process with gifts and updates that come with the yearly Renewal Egg!

Note: For 2023, Standard will not rotate, to allow cards in Standard to remain legal for the full three years. But the Renewal Egg will still make its grand appearance!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Sta.translation:
Standard is Magic: The Gathering's flagship format and is the most widely sanctioned format at all levels of organized play. It's comprised of cards from most sets released in the last three years and is the same format whether you play it on MTG Arena, or on tabletop with paper cards. Rotation is an event usually every year where older cards "rotate" out and are no longer legal, while newer cards can still be played! That way the format is always "fresh" and new strategies and discoveries are always happening. On MTG Arena, we call it "Renewal" and celebrate this process with gifts and updates that come with the yearly Renewal Egg!

Note: For 2023, Standard will not rotate, to allow cards in Standard to remain legal for the full three years. But the Renewal Egg will still make its grand appearance!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Tim.oracleText: Timeless is most similar to Historic in that nearly every card on MTG Arena is legal here and that cards never rotate out. The key difference is that Timeless has few-to-no banned cards, though some of the most powerful are restricted to a maximum of one copy per deck. With a larger card pool than any of the aforementioned formats, Timeless is Magic: The Gathering at its highest level of power – be ready for anything and everything!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Constructed_Tim.translation: Timeless is most similar to Historic in that nearly every card on MTG Arena is legal here and that cards never rotate out. The key difference is that Timeless has few-to-no banned cards, though some of the most powerful are restricted to a maximum of one copy per deck. With a larger card pool than any of the aforementioned formats, Timeless is Magic: The Gathering at its highest level of power – be ready for anything and everything!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/JumpIn/JumpIn_A.oracleText:
Jump In! is an easy to play format that's perfect for newly sparked Planeswalkers to...well...Jump into! In fact, you only need to make two choices before you get right into playing: selecting two different half-decks from a variety of cool themes. Combine them, and you'll have decks with names like "High-Tech Knights" or "Oily Vampires" ready to go!

You might have earned some "Jump-In Tokens" during your journey and here's where you can cash them in! MTG Arena takes care of what lands to play, and while you'll even earn a prize for winning a game, you can play with your deck as many times as you'd like.

This format uses cards legal in Alchemy, and is a good first step toward playing other formats like Draft and Sealed. What are those? Keep playing and you're sure to find out!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/JumpIn/JumpIn_A.translation:
Jump In! is an easy to play format that's perfect for newly sparked Planeswalkers to...well...Jump into! In fact, you only need to make two choices before you get right into playing: selecting two different half-decks from a variety of cool themes. Combine them, and you'll have decks with names like "High-Tech Knights" or "Oily Vampires" ready to go!

You might have earned some "Jump-In Tokens" during your journey and here's where you can cash them in! MTG Arena takes care of what lands to play, and while you'll even earn a prize for winning a game, you can play with your deck as many times as you'd like.

This format uses cards legal in Alchemy, and is a good first step toward playing other formats like Draft and Sealed. What are those? Keep playing and you're sure to find out!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_A.oracleText: Limited events are where you open up packs during the event itself and build a deck out of what you find! You're able to use as many basic lands as you'd like, and the minimum number of cards for these decks is 40, with players playing around 17 lands, but MTG Arena will take care of this for you.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_A.translation: Limited events are where you open up packs during the event itself and build a deck out of what you find! You're able to use as many basic lands as you'd like, and the minimum number of cards for these decks is 40, with players playing around 17 lands, but MTG Arena will take care of this for you.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>What you'll need to do on your own is to decide what nonland cards to play! Most limited decks are 2 colors, with some being 3, often "splashing" a card or two (playing only one or two cards of a third color).
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>What you'll need to do on your own is to decide what nonland cards to play! Most limited decks are 2 colors, with some being 3, often "splashing" a card or two (playing only one or two cards of a third color).

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_C.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Generally you want a fair number of creatures (around 13-15) as that's how you plan to win the game! The rest should be removal spells (cards that remove your opponent's creatures from the battlefield), and maybe one or two combat tricks (cards you can cast during combat to surprise your opponent). Having a couple cards that allow you to draw even more cards is usually not a bad idea! Oh, and you don't want too many cards that cost one mana, or that cost more than five mana. Limited is challenging!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_C.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Generally you want a fair number of creatures (around 13-15) as that's how you plan to win the game! The rest should be removal spells (cards that remove your opponent's creatures from the battlefield), and maybe one or two combat tricks (cards you can cast during combat to surprise your opponent). Having a couple cards that allow you to draw even more cards is usually not a bad idea! Oh, and you don't want too many cards that cost one mana, or that cost more than five mana. Limited is challenging!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_D.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>But great news, cards you draft will be added to your collection! So maybe you spot a card that would go great in one of your constructed decks, or you see something that inspires you to create a deck all your own built around this one card!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_D.translation: <color #CCCCCC>But great news, cards you draft will be added to your collection! So maybe you spot a card that would go great in one of your constructed decks, or you see something that inspires you to create a deck all your own built around this one card!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Express.oracleText: <color #ED5922>There are a few different expressions of limited:
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Express.translation: <color #ED5922>There are a few different expressions of limited:

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_JumpIn_.oracleText: Jump In! bridges the gap between Draft and Sealed and is a great introduction to Limited. Instead of making over 40 choices for a draft, you only make two! You get to select two different half-decks from a variety of themes. Combine them, and you'll then have a deck ready to go! This is the best place to get your feet wet by Jumping In to Limited on Arena!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_JumpIn_.translation: Jump In! bridges the gap between Draft and Sealed and is a great introduction to Limited. Instead of making over 40 choices for a draft, you only make two! You get to select two different half-decks from a variety of themes. Combine them, and you'll then have a deck ready to go! This is the best place to get your feet wet by Jumping In to Limited on Arena!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Premier.oracleText: Draft is the most common form of Limited, and Premier Draft is the gold standard here on MTG Arena. In this event you will Draft 3 packs of Magic: The Gathering cards, with each pack containing around 14 or 15 cards, depending on the set. You'll pick one card out of a pack, then pass it to the player on your "left" You'll then receive the pack to the player on your "right" and repeat the process until every card is chosen.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Premier.translation: Draft is the most common form of Limited, and Premier Draft is the gold standard here on MTG Arena. In this event you will Draft 3 packs of Magic: The Gathering cards, with each pack containing around 14 or 15 cards, depending on the set. You'll pick one card out of a pack, then pass it to the player on your "left" You'll then receive the pack to the player on your "right" and repeat the process until every card is chosen.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Premier.oracleText: <indent=5%><color #CCCCCC>Then you'll open the second pack, and repeat this process, except you'll pass it to the "right". Then with the third pack, you'll pass it back to your "left". Don't worry, MTG Arena will take care of much of this for you, but at the end of the draft you'll have just over 40 cards to make a deck with! MTG Arena will automatically add 17 lands to your deck, but you'll need to "cut" some cards to trim your deck size down to the recommended 40. They'll be in your "sideboard" and not involved in any of your games.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Premier.translation: <indent=5%><color #CCCCCC>Then you'll open the second pack, and repeat this process, except you'll pass it to the "right". Then with the third pack, you'll pass it back to your "left". Don't worry, MTG Arena will take care of much of this for you, but at the end of the draft you'll have just over 40 cards to make a deck with! MTG Arena will automatically add 17 lands to your deck, but you'll need to "cut" some cards to trim your deck size down to the recommended 40. They'll be in your "sideboard" and not involved in any of your games.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_QuickDr.oracleText: This style of Draft is again, similar to Premier Draft but with one twist: You draft with bots! In Quick Draft, there are no pick timers, and no waiting in between picks! So while you'll still play against other human opponents, you'll be drafted with 7 other AI opponents. Do you think you have what it takes to out draft a bot? At any rate, you still get to keep the cards you draft!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_QuickDr.translation: This style of Draft is again, similar to Premier Draft but with one twist: You draft with bots! In Quick Draft, there are no pick timers, and no waiting in between picks! So while you'll still play against other human opponents, you'll be drafted with 7 other AI opponents. Do you think you have what it takes to out draft a bot? At any rate, you still get to keep the cards you draft!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Sealed_.oracleText: Sealed events are unique in that you still only get to build a deck with cards you collect from the event, but there's no drafting! Each player opens a "pool" of 6 packs of Magic, and then attempt to make the best deck they can out of their pool. Each pool is random, but many players try to play as many Rares and Mythic Rares as they can, while still sticking to two or three colors.
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Sealed_.translation: Sealed events are unique in that you still only get to build a deck with cards you collect from the event, but there's no drafting! Each player opens a "pool" of 6 packs of Magic, and then attempt to make the best deck they can out of their pool. Each pool is random, but many players try to play as many Rares and Mythic Rares as they can, while still sticking to two or three colors.

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Traditi.oracleText: This type of Draft is similar to Premier Draft, but with one big difference: Instead of each match going to the player who wins the game, instead you'll play a Best of Three match! Your goal is to win 2 games, and you may sideboard in every game except the first! In sideboarding you can add additional cards you initially cut to your deck you think might be good in that game! You should also probably cut cards that you don't think match up well against your opponent, but that's for you to decide!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Limited_Traditi.translation: This type of Draft is similar to Premier Draft, but with one big difference: Instead of each match going to the player who wins the game, instead you'll play a Best of Three match! Your goal is to win 2 games, and you may sideboard in every game except the first! In sideboarding you can add additional cards you initially cut to your deck you think might be good in that game! You should also probably cut cards that you don't think match up well against your opponent, but that's for you to decide!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_A.oracleText: Preconstructed Decks (Precons) are a mix of Constructed and Limited. You don't need to build a deck beforehand, but you don't select individual cards in the event either: You choose an entire deck!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_A.translation: Preconstructed Decks (Precons) are a mix of Constructed and Limited. You don't need to build a deck beforehand, but you don't select individual cards in the event either: You choose an entire deck!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_B.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>Many events featured on MTG Arena let you choose a deck from a selection, often themed around the newest set release. Oftentimes in the Brawl format, but every Constructed format can be offered as a Preconstructed play mode!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_B.translation: <color #CCCCCC>Many events featured on MTG Arena let you choose a deck from a selection, often themed around the newest set release. Oftentimes in the Brawl format, but every Constructed format can be offered as a Preconstructed play mode!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_ColorCh.oracleText: There's already an event that uses preconstructed decks you might already be aware of: The Color Challenge! Choose your color and win 5 matches to complete the challenge and progress further throughout your MTG Arena journey!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_ColorCh.translation: There's already an event that uses preconstructed decks you might already be aware of: The Color Challenge! Choose your color and win 5 matches to complete the challenge and progress further throughout your MTG Arena journey!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_ColorCh.oracleText: <color #CCCCCC>The Color Challenge is a great way to get more familiar with some of the rules of Magic, so let's jump right in!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_ColorCh.translation: <color #CCCCCC>The Color Challenge is a great way to get more familiar with some of the rules of Magic, so let's jump right in!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_SparkRa.oracleText: Spark Rank is the introduction to MTG Arena's Ranking system. While this Ranked play mode is technically Constructed (you can bring the exact deck you want to play with), it is highly suggested to start with one of these 10 two color Starter Decks. You can easily adjust the deck to exactly how you want to play it, just remember to try remove and add card types in similar amounts! And while it might be enticing to cut boring 'ol lands for exciting new spells, try not to. You need those lands to cast your spells!
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_SparkRa.translation: Spark Rank is the introduction to MTG Arena's Ranking system. While this Ranked play mode is technically Constructed (you can bring the exact deck you want to play with), it is highly suggested to start with one of these 10 two color Starter Decks. You can easily adjust the deck to exactly how you want to play it, just remember to try remove and add card types in similar amounts! And while it might be enticing to cut boring 'ol lands for exciting new spells, try not to. You need those lands to cast your spells!

Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_Starter.oracleText: This Unranked event uses all 10 two color Starter Decks to do battle! Each player can only choose between these 10 decks based around themes accentuated by the ten color pairs of Magic:
Codex/WaysToPlay/Formats/Precons_Starter.translation: This Unranked event uses all 10 two color Starter Decks to do battle! Each player can only choose between these 10 decks based around themes accentuated by the ten color pairs of Magic:
